content.question: ​A ball is thrown through an open window to the ground below. The height of the ball, in meters, at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> seconds after it is thrown can be modeled by the function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>, given by <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals negative 4.9 t squared plus 4.4 t plus 15.24"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4.9</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4.4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>15.24</mn></math>. Which of the following describes the height of the ball above the ground?

choices.label: ​The ball begins at its maximum height of <math alttext="15.240"><mn>15.240</mn></math> meters. The height of the ball decreases until it reaches the ground <math alttext="1.820"><mn>1.820</mn></math> seconds after it leaves the window.

​The ball begins at its maximum height of <math alttext="15.240"><mn>15.240</mn></math> meters. The height of the ball decreases until it reaches the ground <math alttext="2.269"><mn>2.269</mn></math> seconds after it leaves the window.

​After leaving the window, the height of the ball increases to its maximum height of <math alttext="16.228"><mn>16.228</mn></math> meters. Then the height of the ball decreases until it reaches the ground <math alttext="1.820"><mn>1.820</mn></math> seconds after reaching its maximum height.

​After leaving the window, the height of the ball increases to its maximum height of <math alttext="16.228"><mn>16.228</mn></math> meters. Then the height of the ball decreases until it reaches the ground <math alttext="2.269"><mn>2.269</mn></math> seconds after reaching its maximum height.

content.answer: ​After leaving the window, the height of the ball increases to its maximum height of <math alttext="16.228"><mn>16.228</mn></math> meters. Then the height of the ball decreases until it reaches the ground <math alttext="1.820"><mn>1.820</mn></math> seconds after reaching its maximum height.
